comment.body:
For the empty space:
```
qds.it###wrap > div[style="min-height:110px"]
qds.it#$##wrap { margin-top: 0px !important; }
```

Widgets:
```
qds.it##.pc-sezione-home-flusso a[href^="https://whatsapp.com/channel/"]
qds.it##.pc-sezione-home-flusso a[href^="https://qds.it/newsletter"]
qds.it##.pc-sezione-home-flusso a[href="https://qds.it/category/scrivere-lenergia/"]

```

Then, no video on my end.
Ok adding
```
@@||qds.it/wp-content/plugins/digistream/digiplayer/js/videojs.ga.js$script,first-party
||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3.js$script,redirect=google-ima3,domain=qds.it,important
```

I did not use user rules here and there are no filter-updates available in this time. Operas blocker was always on, antivirus is not checking my browser and we can ignore that. issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: Filemoon ads
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Getting rid of the ad blocker detected message on Filemoon, a video source used on pirated movie and anime sites

### Proposed solution

Frankly, I don't know how to solve it.

### Additional information

"
Access Denied.

We have detected that your adblocker is agressively blocking our ads. In order to maintain our website we have blocked your request.

No ads No Videos. Sorry.
" You can't watch the video at all because a message popped up.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

broken link shortener with AdGuard enabled: `mega-enlace.com`

I won't post an example link, because it only works when you arrive at the link shortener coming from one of the sites that use it. _(If you go to the link shortener directly it just redirects to google.com)_

Sites that use it:  (Spanish downloads sites)
```
https://pelisenhd.org/
https://www.latinomegahd.net/
https://gatonplayseries.com/
https://www.peliculasgd.net/
https://www.tododvdfull.com/
```

The main issue seems to be that this link shortener site forces you to click on some ads to move forward. But those ads are blocked by AdGuard.

_note: this link shortener site seems to save your IP address to grant you access for 24h to the downloads, once you complete the steps. This access permission is independent for each of the movie websites._

the link shortener uses these auxiliary domains: 
`todoandroid.live|gadgetzona.net|freeserverhostingweb.club|qwanturankpro.com|notipostingt.com`
`todoandroid.live,gadgetzona.net,freeserverhostingweb.club,qwanturankpro.com,notipostingt.com`
It is in these domains where the ads should show up, so we can click them. But they are blocked, so I can't move forward through the link shortener.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
As far as I can see, we already have a rule to fix it and it works fine on my end (it shouldn't be necessary to click on ads, but wait 30 seconds).
The problem is that extension for Firefox cannot update/download new JavaScript rules.
Could you please add this rule:
```adblock
mega-enlace.com#%#!function(){const e = e=>{const o=new XMLHttpRequest;o.open("POST","/check.php",!0),o.setRequestHeader("Content-type","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"),o.send("a");const t=atob(window.ext_site).replace(/[a-z]/gi,(e=>String.fromCharCode(e.charCodeAt(0)+(e.toLowerCase()<="m"?13:-13))));let n=e.replaceAll('\\"','"');n=n.replace("'+ api_key+ '",window.api_key),n=n.replace("'+ link_out+ \"",window.link_out),n=n.replace(/action="'\+ .*?\+ '"/,`action="${t}"`);var a;const i=(a=n,(new DOMParser).parseFromString(a,"text/html")).querySelector("form"),r=new FormData(i),c=new XMLHttpRequest;c.open("POST",t,!0),c.send(r),window.tab2=window,postMessage("_clicked_b",location.origin)},o={apply:(o,t,n)=>{if(n[1]&&n[1].includes("api_key")){const o=window.link_out,t=window.api_key,a=n[1].match(/window\.open\(.*?\(atob\(main_site\)\).*?("\/.*\.php\?.*=").*?("&.*?=").*?(api_key),"view"/),i=a[1].replaceAll('"',""),r=a[2].replaceAll('"',""),c=n[1].match(/<form target=[\s\S]*?<\/form>/)[0];if(n[1]=n[1].replace("window.location.href","var nulled"),n[1]=n[1].replace("window.open(f","location.assign(f"),n[1]=n[1].replace(/(parseInt\(c\.split\("-"\)\[0\]\)<= 0).*?(\)\{)/,"$1$2"),o&&t&&i&&r&&c)try{"loading"===document.readyState?window.addEventListener("load",(()=>{e(c)}),{once:!0}):e(c)}catch(e){console.debug(e)}}return Reflect.apply(o,t,n)}};window.Function.prototype.constructor=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.constructor,o)}();
```
to user rules, then click on any link which redirects to `mega-enlace.com`, wait a moment (timer should start automatically), then wait 30 seconds and click on the link to destination page.

issue.title: mega-enlace.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.3.13

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

mega-enlace.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

broken link shortener with AdGuard enabled: `mega-enlace.com`

I won't post an example link, because it only works when you arrive at the link shortener coming from one of the sites that use it. _(If you go to the link shortener directly it just redirects to google.com)_

Sites that use it:  (Spanish downloads sites)
```
https://pelisenhd.org/
https://www.latinomegahd.net/
https://gatonplayseries.com/
https://www.peliculasgd.net/
https://www.tododvdfull.com/
```

The main issue seems to be that this link shortener site forces you to click on some ads to move forward. But those ads are blocked by AdGuard.

_note: this link shortener site seems to save your IP address to grant you access for 24h to the downloads, once you complete the steps. This access permission is independent for each of the movie websites._

the link shortener uses these auxiliary domains: 
`todoandroid.live|gadgetzona.net|freeserverhostingweb.club|qwanturankpro.com|notipostingt.com`
`todoandroid.live,gadgetzona.net,freeserverhostingweb.club,qwanturankpro.com,notipostingt.com`
It is in these domains where the ads should show up, so we can click them. But they are blocked, so I can't move forward through the link shortener.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Both rules are working perfectly, thank you.

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Getting rid of the ad blocker detected message on Filemoon, a video source used on pirated movie and anime sites

### Proposed solution

Frankly, I don't know how to solve it.

### Additional information

"
Access Denied.

We have detected that your adblocker is agressively blocking our ads. In order to maintain our website we have blocked your request.

No ads No Videos. Sorry.
" You can't watch the video at all because a message popped up.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Getting rid of the ad blocker detected message on Filemoon, a video source used on pirated movie and anime sites

### Proposed solution

Frankly, I don't know how to solve it.

### Additional information

"
Access Denied.

We have detected that your adblocker is agressively blocking our ads. In order to maintain our website we have blocked your request.

No ads No Videos. Sorry.
" You can't watch the video at all because a message popped up.

comment.body: I will be unavailable for the next 4 hours, I hope I have been supportive enough.

Not reproduced on my end. Note that AdGuard Mobile Ads is redundant for desktop.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
The issue is caused by the filter `Official Polish filters for AdBlock, uBlock Origin and AdGuard`. Please add this rule to user rules:
`pless.pl#@#.blok-artykul > .wrapper-row:nth-of-type(1)` or temporarily disable this filter. 
The problem has been reported to the filter list maintainer https://github.com/MajkiIT/polish-ads-filter/issues/22347.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Getting rid of the ad blocker detected message on Filemoon, a video source used on pirated movie and anime sites

### Proposed solution

Frankly, I don't know how to solve it.

### Additional information

"
Access Denied.

We have detected that your adblocker is agressively blocking our ads. In order to maintain our website we have blocked your request.

No ads No Videos. Sorry.
" You can't watch the video at all because a message popped up.

comment.body:
`https://filemoon.sx/e/ofdwvww5uv1v`
I tried link above and it redirect me to this link ([https://fmoonembed.pro/adblock.html](https://fmoonembed.pro/adblock.html)) for some reason.
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/64583157/c1a981e4-a79a-4b66-a65e-bb998eb0203c)
Also fmoviesz.to (with filemoon player) appears to detect ad blockers
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/64583157/8cf53421-cde1-4a8b-90b1-3577f235affc)

I recommend you to add the same rules in the links shown below maybe this can solve the problems.
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/64583157/deb14ff5-a6e0-4eed-b4bc-ad03bb21019c)
 
BTW i'm using Chrome browser(AdGuard Browser Extension v4.3.13) with AdGuard Base and AdGuard Annoyances filters

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Closes #174897

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Getting rid of the ad blocker detected message on Filemoon, a video source used on pirated movie and anime sites

### Proposed solution

Frankly, I don't know how to solve it.

### Additional information

"
Access Denied.

We have detected that your adblocker is agressively blocking our ads. In order to maintain our website we have blocked your request.

No ads No Videos. Sorry.
" You can't watch the video at all because a message popped up.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
> Youtube won't work whatsoever. I can no longer watch a single video with AdGuard enabled. It used to be the only one that worked. Now it seems YouTube has outsmarted them. I really wish this would get fixed. It's been almost 2 weeks now.

Could you please write to filters@adguard.com or register on Github and write here?

Hello, 

I have a problem with ad blocking on the Disney+ Android Mobile application.  I have the version of Disney+ with ads and when I get to a point where there are ads, Adguard blocks the ads but I lose a few seconds of the video, it skips a song and even if I go back impossible to see the song that was skipped. I haven't had this problem since Dinsey+ on browser. I think the problem comes from blocking the url "eu-west-1.ads.digital.disneyadvertising.com".
